title: [$75] Update ghost text in Expense Threads / Reports

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Slack Thread Context: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C090U774ZH7/p1766084764506399?thread_ts=1766084764.506399&cid=C090U774ZH7 **What the problem is:** The current ghost/placeholder text in report and expense comment boxes is generic: "Write something". The team agreed this does not communicate that Concierge AI can take actions based on the comment, so users may not realize Concierge can create or update expenses. **What the expected output is:** Replace the generic placeholder with copy that clearly signals Concierge can act. The agreed candidate phrases to surface randomly are: Ask Concierge AI to create an expense... Ask Concierge AI to update an expense... Ask Concierge AI to correct an expense... This should only be the placeholder text within expense threads / reports

**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/576448 ## Expected Result: In a user's status page, if they are set as the Vacation Delegate of anyone else, we want to show this so it's clear they have been set as someone's delegate. Note: users who are someone else's Vacation Delegate should NOT be able to set a delegate of their own (this follows OldDot behavior) Another note: There are probably backend change associated with this (example: Making sure users get live updates when someone sets them as their vacation delegate). Note any of those changes that we may need to implement and we will find someone to implement üëç ## Screenshots/Videos Plan for NewDot: Similar view from OldDot: [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Add `Converted` amount in expense thread for multi-currency cash expenses

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
We're encountering user confusion in multi-currency "cash expense" situations, specifically when the expense purchase currency and the workspace currency are not the same. We already handle this natively for the Expensify Card and third-party credit cards, via an `Original` pattern (like below). We'd like to handle this similarly cash expenses, including receipt scans and per diem expenses (Note: distance and time expenses use a rate and amount that matches the workspace currency, so they don't apply.). All in all the solution looks like this: - When `expense-type` is `cash` or `per diem `... - In the expense thread... - Show `Converted` text in the "dot separator," followed by the amount in the workspace output currency.... - What appears in the `Amount` push row is the original purchase currency and amount (unless manually changed by the user).
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @ZhenjaHorbach

title: [$250] [AA Hold] Set proper creation timestamp to the new report optimistically created for the unapproved expenses at partial approval

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
Held on the [backend changes](https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/566075) that enables the new system message. # Part of the [Hold for Advanced Approval](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/56386) project Main issue: https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/56386 Doc section: [Here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Zc5I6TYdIEcWO1UmW7EgyN-WN7dNFMBLuehEE62-Tp4/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.mrgvlpxapae) Project: #migrate # Feature Description When an approver only approves the unheld transactions on a report, and the held transactions are moved to a new report, the following happens: - a new report is optimistically created (this works already) - We set the same creation timestamp to the new report as well as to its `CREATED` reportAction, as that of the original report. This is the current issue at hand - we optimistically copy all workflow-related actions from the original report to the new report (issue [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/74575)) - we optimistically create the system message that explains to the user that the report was created for moving the unapproved expenses from the original report (issue [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/74577)) The backend has the following logic: - Computes the original report creation timestamps - if the report has a `CREATED` reportAction, it takes its `created` timestamp - else is takes the original report `created` timestamp - Sets the timestamp computed above as the - `created` value for the new report - `created` value for the `CREATED` reportAction added to the new report Let's optimistically do the same on the front-end.

title: Standardize product behavior using "Global Create"

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
While it's possible to create expenses/receipts pretty much anywhere in the app, the post-creation experience can differ quite a bit. Consider this case:

- User is on Reports ‚Üí To-do ‚Üí Submit
- The search results return nothing
- The empty state prompts them to create an expense ‚Äî so they do
 - But in many instances, the expense isn't part of the search result, so it looks like nothing happened

To resolve this issue, let's standardize the post-creation experience for Global Create and the mobile receipt FAB as follows:

 - **If the user is on Inbox and creates an expense, navigate them post-creation to their workspace chat**
 - **If the user is any other page in the app, navigate them post-creation to Reports ‚Üí Expenses**, highlighting the newly created expense in the table

Any question, let me know!


<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @huult</details>

title: Remove "workspace chat" section and link from workspace editor (for everyone)

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
We originally posited that added a workspace chat link for members and admins would be a helpful way to find expenses, reports and learn how to create expenses. However that hypothesis has been debunked for several reasons: - Recurring FullStory sessions where users click the link and immediately leave in favor of the Reports page - "Global" create options in the desktop LHB and mobile receipt FAB - On-going user activity that is more and more anchored to Reports and Workspaces So as a result, we're removing this link to prevent users from clicking a link that is not useful for them in practice.
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @DylanDylann
